Info.Description: This module describes the Common Data elements and Macros for O-RADS

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Location
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: NOTE: If you do not see ovarian tissue, and the lesion does not meet criteria for a hydrosalpinx, select “Ovarian/Adnexal”

Choice.Label: Paraovarian cyst (if not simple, select as per ovarian/adnexal and cystic)
Simple cyst separate from the ovary
Moves independent of the ovary with transducer pressure
Follows contour of adjacent pelvic organs or peritoneum
Endosalpingeal folds (short round projections around inner wall)
Corpus luteum (thick-walled cyst/solid-appearing, peripheral vascularity, ≤ 3 cm)
Cystic (must have no internal flow on Doppler)

ChoiceDataElement.Label: If this is a follow-up exam, and lesion has not resolved or decreased?
Cystic lesion
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: *NOTE: A unilocular cyst may contain an incomplete septation **NOTE: Focal wall irregularity < 3 mm in height, and blood or dermoid contents are NOT considered a “solid component”

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Inner Margin
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: *NOTE: An incomplete septation alone is NOT considered an irregular inner margin and would still qualify as smooth as long as no focal wall thickening is present

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Papillary projections
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: NOTE: A solid component is considered a papillary projection if it protrudes into a cyst lumen, is surrounded by fluid on 3 sides, and measures ≥ 3 mm in height. If the solid component does not meet this criteria, select “# 0 - 3”

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Include all O-RADS categories in impression

Branch.Label: Intraovarian - premenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - size less than 5
Intraovarian - premenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - greater 5 and less than 10 - followup no
Intraovarian - premenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - greater 5 and less than 10 - followup yes
Intraovarian - postmenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - less than 10
Intraovarian - premenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - greater than equals 10
Intraovarian - premenopausal - Hemorrhagic cyst - greater than equals 10 - peritoneal yes
Intraovarian - premenopausal - dermoid_cyst - greater than equals 10
Intraovarian - premenopausal - dermoid_cyst - greater than equals 10 peritoneal yes
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal - dermoid_cyst - less 10 confident dx
Intraovarian - premenopausal - cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth
Intraovarian - premenopausal - cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst 3 - 5 cm
Intraovarian - premenopausal - cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst 6 - 9 cm
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst - greater than eqauls 10 cm - peritoneal_nodules no
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst - greater than eqauls 10 cm - peritoneal_nodules yes
Intraovarian - postmenopausal - cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst less than equals 3cm
Intraovarian - postmenopausal -cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - symple cyst 3-9 cm
Intraovarian - premenopausal -cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst less than equals 3 cm
Intraovarian - premenopausal -cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst 4-9 cm
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst greater than eqauls 10 cm - peritoneal_nodules NO
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst greater than eqauls 10 cm - peritoneal_nodules yes
Intraovarian - postmenopausal -cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst less than equals 3
Intraovarian - postmenopausal -cystic - Unilocular - no_solid - smooth - no symple cyst 4-9 cm
Intraovarian - cystic - Unilocular - solid - Papillary_projections - 1to3 peritoneal_nodules NO
Intraovarian - pre/postmenopausal -cystic - Multilocular - no_solid - smooth - score 1-3 - less than 10cm - peritoneal_nodules NO

Branch.ReportText: simple cyst separate from the ovary
moves independent of the ovary with transducer pressure
follows contour of adjacent pelvic organs or peritoneum
O-RADS 0 = Incomplete due to technical factors
O-RADS 1. Recommend no additional imaging or follow-up.
O-RADS 2. Recommend no additional imaging or follow-up.
O-RADS 2. Recommend management per gynecologist. May consider a single follow-up US examination in 1 year.
O-RADS 2. Recommend follow-up US examination in 8-12 weeks.
O-RADS 2. Recommend follow-up US examination in 8-12 weeks. If concerning, recommend referral to an US specialist or for a MRI study.
O-RADS 2. As this is likely physiologic, recommend repeat US examination in 8 – 12 weeks.
O-RADS 2. Refer to an US specialist, recommend MRI or gynecologist.
O-RADS 2. recommend referral to an US specialist or for a MRI study.
O-RADS 2. If not surgically excised, recommend follow-up US examination in 1 year.
O-RADS 2. Recommend follow-up US examination in 1 year.
O-RADS 2. Recommend follow-up US examination in 1 year. If concerning, recommend referral to an US specialist or for a MRI study.
O-RADS 2. Recommend MRI for further characterization.
O-RADS 3. Recommend referral to an US specialist or for a MRI study. May be managed by gynecologist.
O-RADS 4. Recommend referral to an US specialist or for a MRI study. May be managed by gynecologist with gynecologic-oncologist consultation or solely by gynecologic-oncologist.
